content.detailedDescription: My first husband and i were picking up another couple who had an apartment on the beach, off ocean view ave, on the chesapeake bay, norfolk, va, about nov. 1, 1974. (this event occurred anytime from the 1st to the 10th of nov.  i know this because we were on our way to hear billy graham. i checked with their organization. he had a crusade there nov.1-10, 1974. the 1st was a friday, and i think that was the night we went.) we parked, went into their apt. a few minutes, then stepped outside onto the sand to leave. i happened to glance up and said, "what's that?". hovering silently over the beach, where the water meets the sand, at about tree-top level was a flying object. it was round, like two saucers put rim to rim.  around the rim were white lights going around. there was a single red light on top. it was large enough to hold several people. all four of us saw it. we weren't frightened, just startled and perplexed. i was a little awestruck. we stood and watched it for quite awhile, then it started to move east down the beach very slowly. it did not change altitude. there was no sound.  we hopped into the car and drove east on ocean view ave., which runs parallel to the beach. by looking out the window to our left, we could just see it between the buildings.  we followed it until we lost sight of it,(we had stop lights) then went on to see billy graham.  i'd say the whole event lasted 15 min. or so. we didn't report it, as norfolk is a navy town, and we thought it might have been some experimental craft. i did check the newspapers the next day to see if anyone else saw anything, but couldn't find any information. even though it was many years ago, i remember it vividly and i'm sure my ex-husband does too.  unfortunately, i cannot remember the name of the other couple. my husband's name at that time was mark lewis. he was in the navy and was stationed in norforlk in 1973-1974, where we lived on ocean view ave. if you have any questions, feel free to contact me.
content.summary: Saucer-shaped, white lights around rim, over beach

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving home mid afternoon approximatly a half hour east of north bay ontario on hwy.#17. it was raining sporadically and weather was heavily overcast with fast moving low clouds. the light caught my eye from the far right of my fov. it was sillouetted against a background of trees on a hillside. as i focused my attention on the object it proceed to shoot across the sky  from my farthest right,. to my farthest left so fast i could barely track it. i knew right away that i had seen a ufo because no aircraft we use can move so rapid from standstill. i remember feeling awestruck because although im not a sceptic. im a type of guy who wont believe something until i see with my own eyes. the clouds were very low {aprox. 500 ft} and the craft flew underneath the cloud cover which made it quite clear to see the shape. i pulled over on the highway in hopes to see the object but never seen it again. i noticed the car behind also slowed down and their eyes were fixed to the spot where i lost sight of the craft which i assumed they had also seen it as well.

http://www.Ufocasebook.Com/vancouverislandcanada.Jpg im attacting this link because when i seen this picture it reminded me almost identically of what i had seen that day.
content.summary: Silver reflective surface, point in the front,. larger in the back with a light at rear

content.detailedDescription:
I was about to pull off to park and eat at burbank's "smoke house" restaurant just actoss the street from warner bros. studio. it was about 4:50 pm. while at the light, i looked out and a dark object caught my eye.  by the time we parked, i had found the object again, but this time saw a second one as well.  they were very high, and sat perfectly still, despite a bit of a breeze.

when i got out of my car, my wife thought they were kites, but after seeing them perfectly still, it became obvious that they weren't.  i looked over and there was another man looking up at them as well.  he called over after he saw us looking up and said there was a second one. i said, yes i saw that one as well.  the entire time we watched the event, the two objects remained a perfect distance apart from each other. maybe 300 yards from each other.

as we walked to the restaurant, we kept a close eye on the object, they didn't seem to move the entire time.  we even pointed it out to another woman who was also going to the same place to eat.  she too had no idea what they could be.  without anything to judge size or hight of the objects, i couln't give an exact report. my best guess, however, would have the objects the size of a car and approximetly 2000 feet up.

i asked my wife today what shape she thought they were and she responded closer to a triangle than a disk shape, but i remember it more like an upside down french fry basket.  it was dark and definetly had shaded areas that lead me to believe it wasn't totally smooth.  it was close to a disk shape, but had demention.

we didn't have time to stand there and spend the night looking into the sky, so we eventually went in to eat, leaving the objects behind.  when we came out an hour and a half later, it was dark and couldn't see a thing.
i'd love to know if anyone else reported the sighting.
my feeling at the time was "what the hell is that?" very curious.
thanks,

kenny
content.summary: Two objects hovering above burbank ca that remained motionless. very high and very still.

content.detailedDescription: Driving, heading east, saw lights in the eastern, lower sky, straight ahead of me.  it seemed about 10 miles ahead of me, perhaps above the area of gold canyon, az.  lights were low in sky, and in a straight line, the far left one going out and coming back on.  it did not look like anything i have ever seen before, not man-made.  the lights disappeared very suddenly. my 16-year old daughter was with me and we both watched them until they disappeared.  the sky was very dark at this time.  there was no wavering of the lights, they were steady and in a perfectly straight line slanted downward to the right, almost a 45 degree angle.  and yes, they did look very similar to the recent phoenix lights (early february 2007), but these were much closer and more defined and were slanted downward. definitely not something dropped by parachute or on fire (flaring).  it was stationary in the sky; no movement at all. it was exactly 6:50 p.M., definitely a tuesday night, i think it was early january.  i make this trip every tuesday night at this exact time and my daughter and i have watched the sky and area each time.  i have not seen anything like it since then.
content.summary: 4 or 5 separate lights, in straight line, far let one blinking on and off

content.detailedDescription:
it was the 4th of july, 1997 when my mother, sister and i were driving home from a department store in fairview heights, illinois. fairview heights is only about a half hour drive from st. louis, missouri but on the illinois side of the mississippi river. we took a short cut down some country, back roads that would help us avoid the holiday traffic. though st. clair county is a highly populated area, it still has a little bit of farm land left. 
   we stopped on one of the back roads to watch a fireworks display that was visable in the distance. it was being heald at a store about a mile away. we sat there for about 5 minutes watching when my mother asked me if a car was coming. i looked behind me but saw no car. this was odd because our whole car was engulfed in light. it was as if we were sitting under a street light but we were in the middle of nowhere (sort of) my mother asked me if there was a car as more of a confirmation than a question. when i confirmed that i didn't see a car either, we both looked into the corn field on the side of the road to see if someone was shining a flashlight into our car. when we saw that no one was in the field we got a little worried. (not that some maniac in a corn field with a flash light on the 4th of july would have been a welcome sight.)
   no car, no maniac, we were starting to worry. then, out of the corner of my eye i saw something both amazing and terrifying at the same time. a large blue ...Something... was in the sky above us and a little to the left of us. the object was shaped sort of like a saucer with a tail. we only saw it for a brief monent. we didn't stick around long enough to see the *inside* of it, if you know what i mean. 
   i don't know what i saw was and no matter how hard i try, i can not logically explain away the event. not using the logic that holds with the rest of the worlds views as *logical*. though i can't tell you what i did see, i can tell you what i did not see. i didn't see a plain or jet. i didn't see a helecolptor. i didn't see a commit or metior. i didn't see a satelite. i didn't see a missile. i didn't see a rocket ship, and i sure as hell didn't see a weather baloon!
   i must note that the next morning my mother brought home the latest edition of the st. louis, post dispatch (newspaper). on the front page was a picture of the thing that we say the night before. it was seen over the st. louis v.P. fair at about the same time we saw it. hundreds of people reported seeing it including the reporter who wrote the article. he contacted scott air force base that night. (a militairy instilation a few miles from where i saw the object). scott afb reported that they picked up nothing out of the ordinairy and that there were no strange atmosphereic phanomina that night that they were aware of. they also stated that they were not flying any aircrafts at that time (or weather baloons).
   i know what i saw and i know what i didn't see. you might think i am out of my mind or incapable of distinguishing between a sky scraper and a helecopter but i know what i saw. it was no weather baloon either.
content.summary: Blue, teardropish (blob), shaped ufo spotted in o'fallon illinois on the 4th of july, 1997

content.detailedDescription: My wife,two daughters, dog and i were walking west on east 26 st toward our home at around senven twenty pm. it ws a clear night. as i walked west with my dog,i suddenly noticed an object that appeared to be a meteor. i called to my wife and kids and we observed the firebal. as the fireball made a descent, it split into two. after the split the two objects stopped in mid air and split into four to six object. one by one each object dissapeared in an orderly fashion, and reaappeared in a orderly fashion. it was spectacular. a few moments later the objects merged into one object and continued in a south western direction.
content.summary: Meteor splits into two stops in mid air and splits into four

content.detailedDescription: I went to outside to start my car at app. 5:55 am.  it was still dark. i noticed 4 bright lights in the sky at treetop level.  i walked closer to the treeline.  the lights didn't move and i didn't hear any noise at all.  i went back inside and approximately 7 minutes later i went back outside.  the lights were gone.
content.summary: Row of 4 stationary lights that stayed at treetop level w/no noise

content.detailedDescription: I saw 5 ufos. im 15 dont laugh at me. it was 1 or 2 years ago i think. it was summer. i saw the first one at 7:30 before sunset. my mom was with me. i looked at the sky and i saw a silver rice shaped ufo and it was shiny. there was a jet to i dont know if it was chasing it it was real fast. it went away in a few seconds. my mom didnt see it. then another night i was walking with my mom and i saw the second one. it looked like a big and yellow star and i thought it was a weird star. it was about 9:00. it was like that a while then some jets went by and in a minute it moved and turned into a black triangle with three lights. i dont know if they were yellow or white. it flew over my apartments and i told my mom to look and she thought it was a plane. i told my step dad and he said it was a stealth plane but they dont do that. then another night i went on a walk and i was looking for ufos. i saw three stars in a triangle and they looked like the other stars. then they moved and turned so they were on the other side and went over walgreens and they looked like they were coming down and i got scared. they were moving away from each other then i couldnt see them.
content.summary: I saw three ufos

content.detailedDescription:
Last summer the space station flew over chicago at the time indicated. not knowing what to see i was looking for any thing that moved. my house faces south, in my frt. yard i look up and saw a star like object moving at a good speed. i thought this was it and came back in then i saw the time was off so i went back out and saw the real shuttle go over head. 

the news media interviewed a man who had pictures of the object(three orbs) but that was the end of the interview. the station was abc 7 or nbc 5.

this has troubled me as to what i saw. 

the star object i saw was so farr away all it looked lkie was a star but not a shooting star. this one moved left to right in a z patteren and went out of sight.
content.summary: Space shuttle fly over and a sighting.

content.detailedDescription: My husband and i went outside after dinner to smoke, as we were standing on the back deck of our home we were talking about a recent article my husband had read about all of the "junk" that is floating around in space due to sattelites or whatever. i looked up at the sky towards the south and thought to myself how clear the sky was and how beautiful the stars were that night. out of the corner of my eye i saw this strange object appear from the east. i immediately said to my husband, "what is that?" he then turned around and saw it also. i can only describe it as looking like a group of birds flying in a v formation. although i am quite certain it was not birds (at least not any that i have ever seen before). it was a v or triangular shape and had no outline it just had about a dozen bird shaped objects forming a triangle. it was white almost transparent kind of like it was reflecting off of something. it was about two tree lengths high ( im horrible at judging distances) i know that birds do not fly that high! it was also extremely quiet. no noise whatsoever. it headed towards the west and then after about five to ten seconds it was gone it just dissapeared. the sky was very clear so i know that it didn't go behind a cloud. my husband and i were speachless and then the reality hit us of what we had just seen. he told me to go into the house right away. he was so alarmed by it that he went and got his shotgun out of the gun cabinent and put it beside the bed that night. neither my husband nor i believe in ufo's or alians however, i know that what we saw wednesday night was not normal. believe me we have tried to explain it away. my twelve year old son is the one who encouraged me to report this. he found this website so that is the only reson i am reporting this. i have included my e-mail address please help me to "make sense" of this because believe me i could probably be staring an alian in the face and still be saying i dont believe in them. hopefully there is some kind of scientific explanation for what we saw. thank you for your time in reading this.
content.summary: It came out of nowhere flying from east to west . it appeared to be flying in a v formation as aflock of birds might do, although birds arent shiny and white and they do not fly that high up in the sky.

content.detailedDescription:
My friend and i took a drive and remarked how clear the skies were, noted venus (25 - 30 degrees up from the horizon.) venus was very bright (white) in the sky.  this was approximately 6:30pm (central.)

my friend and i witness two orange balls (one larger than the other) at 7:05pm (central.)  these objects were moving. these objects appeared to be very near the monroe city area, we were in washington driving west. i quickly found venus which was evident and about to set, these orange balls were not venus. each orange ball quickly dissappeared (not at the same time.)  we were travelling west on a country road and saw them reappear in a different location.  one orange ball was larger and quickly disappeared.  when it did disappear i noticed a twinkling at the location it disappeared.  my friend and i noticed about 4 - 6 other twinkling objects (which were moving.)  from then on we observed frequent (5 - 7 minutes) of orange balls appearing and disappearing at approximately 15 - 20 degrees up from the horizon.  during this time you could see the same twinkling after (some) of the sightings.  a drawing of the most common observation (two balls) is attached.

over the next 3 - 5 minutes we observed a series of appear/disappear events with up to 3 orange balls, some very close to the ground (a 3 ball drawing is attached).  i then notice an orange ball, low to the horizon, move straight up, sort of bob up and down then disappear.  2 or 3 minutes passed and we saw the large ball appear followed by 4 more in an semi-circle line and another ball appearing(6 at the same time.) drawing of this incident is attached.

at this time we called jerry sievers (vincennes) of indiana mufon (approximatly 7:20pm central.) at approximately 7:25pm central we observed one more orange ball appear/disappear much further south (south of monroe city 3 miles) which was very low in the horizon.  

our last observation was one of the twinkling objects which passed directly over our heads (approximately 1000 feet) at 7:28pm central.  we could not discern a sound and the object had one red light and a swirling strobe (swirling around in a circle).  the strobe was very odd and we both commented how (un-airplane like) the strobe was. we could not clearly make out the shape of the object.  the object was traveling north.  we waited several minutes longer and did not see any more activity (7:45pm central.)

we must have observed orange balls at least 18 - 20 times over the 25 minutes.  sometimes the balls were stationary, some times they were moving.  the largest gap in time between sightings was 4 - 5 minutes. one time a smaller orange ball seemed to be rotating around a larger orange ball before both disappeared.  our conclusion was that we were witnessing a ufo incident.  each time we observed a new orange ball we shouted "there it is, there's another one."  

we tried to reason away these objects as flares, meteors and airplanes.  the orange balls varied in "orange" intensity.  each observation was different from the previous observation in movement and location.  we did not believe they were flares due to the multiple locations (across the horizon) which we viewed these objects and the twinkling after some of the post-disappearance observations.  there were no trailing tails as seen with meteors.  the low altitude made us certain these were not airplanes especially when the 6 orange ball event (at the same time) happened.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Multiple orange balls witnessed that dissappeared and reappeared over 25 minutes

content.detailedDescription:
I was taking a picture of the moon and when i check up the picture in my computer i zoomed this object.I never saw anything untill i put it in my computer i woul like to know what could be this object.Here is the picture you have to zoom it so you can see it.
i have since them a lot of picture that i've been taking some of them very weird if. i want some body to analize it let me know if you can do it
content.summary: I took a picture to the moon and when i check the picture in my computer i detected this object

content.detailedDescription: I was traveling home from work at aprox 4 am in the morning. while i was traveling on swedesboro rd [ rt 538 ] heading south i noticed a bright stationaly light off into the distance straight ahead. as i pulled up to my driveway i got out of the car and saw the light fall to the ground. it dissapeared behind the tree line. it may of landed near the malaga lake area. since our area is in the extended traffic pattern for phila international it is normal to see airplane lights fly over our house at night. it was not an airplane or landing lights from an airplane. it was not a meteor because it was stationary in the sky and not appear to be moving. it could of been moving toward me but i am not sure. we checked in the news for plane crashes and heard nothing.
content.summary: Watched a stationary bright light suddenly fall to the earth.

content.detailedDescription:
on tuesday, january 23, 2007, at approximately 7:40p.M. i was driving se with my four year old son on my way home from a friends house when i spotted what i thought at first was a planet, maybe venus.

this object was to my left in the eastern sky, and looked to be a few miles away from me--(after some research i found out that this object was most probably 2-3 miles away from my location when i first spotted it.) 

this object was very bright, and a light orange color. even though i thought it looked awful large for a planet, i still assumed it must be since it was not twinkling like stars do.

i pointed the light out to my son, and proceeded to bore him with trivia like how to tell if a star is a star or if its a planet. the object was in my view the entire time i was driving-(except short periods when trees obscured it.) a little over 2 miles up the road i had to make a left turn to head due east. i had started thinking there was something weird looking about the light so once i turned, and saw no other cars were coming, i stopped in the road to have a safer look.

this was when i noticed the light was moving, and also that it was not a single light, but three lights! i thought to myself that it was weird for an airplane to have three large lights underneath it like that because for it to have been an airplane the two front lights would have had to have been on the end of each wing, and the third rear one on the tail, but all would have had to have been directly underneath the object.

these lights all looked to be the same distance apart and were very big looking lights, all large, all the same color, no pulsing, or color changing, and they were set in a triangle pattern--(note i stated the shape of the craft was triangular, but i am unsure of the actual shape of the craft itself--only what formation the three lights were in.) 

one thing that struck me as very odd as well was that the triangle formation was backwards---the two side by side lights were leading, with the 'tip' bringin up the rear.

they didn't appear to be landing lights, and after later checking a map i realized the 'plane' was not coming from, or going towards the direction of the closest airport anyway, so i'm sure it wasn't landing or taking off.

the object was closer to me by the time i stopped to look and was heading towards me in a diagonal path. i made no unusual note of speed, or movement--(it appeared to move slowly, but i wouldn't say notably slow, nor did i see any unusual movements that defy conventional aircraft performance.) i heard no sounds as if an airplane, or helicopter, was passing overhead, but i never actually cut my van off, so i suppose it's possible there were some sounds.

this object appeared to be flying pretty low, yet was too high for me to make out any of the aircraft itself--i could only see the three lights. it's possible this may have been a normal, everyday aircraft, but i have to say that i've been driving for many years, and have been out lots of times at night, and i have seen many, many, airplanes, helicopters, and such in the night sky at varying distances. i've seen all kinds of colored lights on planes at night time,at different altitudes, sometimes steady, sometimes blinking and blipping around.

more than a few of them have given me pause, but i always realize very quickly that it is in fact just an airplane, or some other form of 'normal' aircraft. i can't say as i've ever seen three big orange colored lights in that formation on the very bottom of an airplane like that before. ever.

to give you an idea of the distance away from me, as well as the size of these lights, it would have probably taken a nickle held out at arms length in order to have covered just one of the 3 lights. 

so, just when the object was about to pass overtop of me, a car ended up turning on the road behind me that i was stopped on, so i drove up to the next side road and turned on it to find a place to turn around and try to watch this thing some more.

i did this in about a one minute time period, losing sight of the object as i did so. i made a left onto this side road, went a very short distance, then turned left again into a dirt path that was in front of a clearing. this put me facing straight at where i had just came from. i stopped and searched out the object, finding it easily as it made its way in the same diagonal trek, but in front and away from me this time.

i sat there maybe 30 more seconds as it grew smaller in the distance, then drove home, calling the person whos house i had just left from to tell him that i thought i may have just seen a ufo--(this is the reason i am positive about the time and duration of the sighting due to my cell call log.)

don't know if this is helpful or not, but my physical coordinates around the time i first laid eyes on the object were at roughly
 lat: -76.9872522354126 - lon: 36.74926092648688  
and after studying a map of the area, and judging by the horizontal direction this object was flying in while it was coming towards me on black creek rd--(when i realized first this thing was three lights)--i estimate that the craft was coming from the vicinity of the following coordinates; lat: -76.96995735168457 - lon: 36.75394593241057

i wanted to add that i filed my sighting with the nuforc the night after i saw this. i've recieved no response from them, but my report is now posted on their site.

the night after i submitted to the nuforc site, i was googling around, in search of any other possible information, or witnesses, that may have came forward about the same sighting and came across the hbcc ufo research site owned by a very nice man by the name of brian vike.

i filed a report with his site as well, which led to a subsequent radio interview i did for him for his weekly radio show called the vike report, that aired this past sunday.

since i filed my report with those two sites, i have been trying to locate any other possible reports that may pertain to what i saw. i've called my local paper here in franklin, 'the tidewater news', as well as contacted a lady from a bigger paper, 'the virginian pilot', to see if either of the papers had any reports. both were negative.

i also contacted via email one of our local news channels,wavy tv-10, which also turned out to be a dead end. i have kept an eye and an ear out for anything pertaining to any unusual sightings made that day, or that week, but so far have found nothing. i am confused because i find it so hard to believe i was the only person to see this! 

this is a big reason why i decided to file with your site as well--i got to thinking that with my report on these three main ufo research site, that maybe out of the three, maybe someone from my area might see my report who also saw what i did, and decide to contact one of you. i hope so, anyway.

i made and am sending you two drawings i made via a computer paint program. one drawing represents pretty much the exact way i saw the object in the sky--the direction it was heading, as well as the size in relation to how it looked to me up in the sky from my van. 

the other represents how large the 'orange planet' appeared to me when i first spotted it by comparing it to the 'north star'--(my north star isn't meant to say thats how big the north star really is, but only to show a comparison--in other words, this is how much bigger my object was in relation to how big the north star might look.)

i also am sending a map that i located online detailing exactly where i was while seeing this object.

thank you so much for your time.
content.summary: Three orange lights in a triangle formation

content.detailedDescription:
I am not sure this is the correct way or place to relate an unusual sky event i witnessed last sunday, february 4rd., 2007 in mesa arizona but will try.

at or about 5 pm i was sitting out on her patio of a friends house i am visiting when watching the late afternoon aircraft heading into land at phx, they were shinning and practically glowing in the low afternoon sun with a clear sky. i was facing east when i noticed off to my right a small object, traveling north, seemingly floating along rather lazily, almost hovering and assumed it was a balloon some child had lost grab of.  i was hard to tell how high it was as it never was close enough visually to judge if it was in ���front��� of or ���behind��� the path of the aircraft.

i really didn���t give it much thought however with the approach of the next aircraft i noticed it was till there and seemed to be almost at the same place. this caught my attention since it had not appeared to change position or altitude in those several minuets.
 i then observed this object for at least another 15 minuets.

my first impression of it ���hovering��� was incorrect in fact it was very slowly ���drifting��� south along the same direction as the aircraft were heading toward phx.

i specifically say object since observing it i was able to determine it had volume and some colors;
this was due to that low sun; although i was observing something that was approximately an eight of an inch to my eye at that distance and height (still unknown) it was enough to determine shading associated with a visual volume. i was still under the impression it was merely a balloon or perhaps a bunch of balloons sine there seem to be changes of color; orangeish yellowish and what seems to be either a whitish light of something reflecting, these color changes were not in sequence or of any discernible pattern but then i was looking at some rather tiny in my fielded of vision. 

after a few moments either i simply first noticed or it appeared suddenly behind this object (i will explain later how i determined that too was solid) another smaller bright silver ���dot���, i assume this was a ball.

my first reaction up on seeing the second object was this indeed must be nothing more than a bunch of balloons but no sooner had i thought than i realized this was mostly likely not the case. i say that because it was about two and a half inches behind the first object. if it was a balloon that had separated from the bunch it was on a string of unlikely tremendous length. if it had separated from the bunch unattached it was following at exactly the same speed and altitude and in fact never altered from the full course of this event. in other words it maintained its relative position to the larger ���first��� object even during an interesting change of course.

 after several minuets of observation during which time it traveled from my far right to a position to just past my left, a path in constant speed and altitude for several minuets, i realized it was slowly turning toward my relative position, that is toward the west. as i continued to observe it drifted along making a large u-turn so as to be slightly in ���back��� of my position but almost to it, much closer than it was before.  it then straightens out to what seemed a parallel path to its first observation and finally retreated out of my view.

once again there appeared to be no change in speed or altitude or the color changes and the same held true of the small following silver object. however after completing the u of the turn the small silver object behind turned dark, this indicated to me that it might be a reflective surface since the sunlight on it was now in a different position relative to my position and this was the ���shadow��� side i was now seeing.  after a short time it was hard to see the small following silver object but the first object was at a constant level of brightness thorough out the observation leaving me to wonder if in fact it was self-illuminated rather than from the sunlight.

i was never able to fully distinguish a ���shape��� for the first object but i was left with an impression it was more vertical, that is higher than wide.

i did point these objects out to my friend who was coming in and out during the observation time but she was less interested so i at least have a witness who in fact saw the same thing.

i have no idea if this is of any interest to you. as to my feelings? well i have no strong opinion as to what this may have been but, however, it was most interesting to me and unlike anything i have ever observed, enough so to take this time to report my first very own ufo sighting.
content.summary: Two unusual objects and movements

content.detailedDescription:
I hadn't thought much about this event for many years but am now interested in it again.  i am estimating i was about 12 years old which puts this event in the 1967 time frame.   sorry i don't have a better date.

i remember it was a very nice summer day and i was on summer vacation from school.   i had gone out in to our back yard to play about 9am.   temperature was very pleasant (i remember having a t-shirt).   i could hear the pounding of the drop hammers at the local forging factory several blocks away (american logging tool).   the sky was beautiful and had occational big puffy fair weather clouds floating by (can't remember their direction).

i looked up in the sky to the west and saw something.  i thought at first it was an aircraft and i loved aircraft so continued watching.   it was tracking straight from west to east and came right over our back yard.   

i saw a show on tv a while back (discovery or history channel) and they showed a picture that clicked as to being very similar to what i saw.   that is what piqued my interest in learning more about this ufo.

it appears to be in the cigar classification.   it was silver in color and the closest shape i could liken it to is the goodyear blimp on the ends.   some pictures i have seen look more pointed than my object and just don't fit.

the object did not have any lights.   the object was totally silent.  i remember birds (robins) singing the entire time.   the very odd thing was the object was rotating.   not in a spiral like a football but about its lateral axis (like a boomarang).   i would estimate its rotational rate to be 1 revolution per second.


as i said it tracked in a perfectly straight line from west to east.   i yelled at my mom to come out and see but she said she was busy.  i yelled again and she yelled back she was on the phone.   so i just stood there and watched.   the total trip was about 30 seconds.   it passed below the clouds.

i have been unable to find anything similar in the time period i have estimated (+/2 years in michigan (or elsewhere in this region).   

i had pretty much forgotten about the incident.   i worked for mcdonnell douglas in flight test for many years and saw a lot of very cool stuff.   i have worked with structures, flight controls and propulsions groups and nothing i have worked with would give me any clues to what i saw.   when i saw the picture on tv it clicked and i remember thinking "damn, what was that thing?".   i am also a licensed private pilot.

in reviewing your points to be covered i would like to mention the flight path of the object and its maneuvering were not radom or irratic.   everything was smooth and deliberate.   there were no course changes or apparent altitude.

my feelings were neutral.  i didn't know what it was and i was looking at it with more wonder than anything.   i was not afraid of it.   afterwards i returned to my playing and bike riding.   

i lost sight of the object as it traveled east and traveled beyond the tree line.

i would love to see some pictures of cigar shaped objects to see if i could identify it.   when i see it i will know.   it is hard to estimate the size as i don't know what it's altitude was.   something in the area of 100 feet long and maybe 30 feet in diameter would probably get in the ballpark of size and proportions.   rounded ends, not very pointy though.
content.summary: Rotating cigar shaped

content.detailedDescription: I was in my car driving east when i came to an intersection and stopped there to make a left turn. while stopped i noticed a spherical object moving across the sky from north to south  slowly at maybe 45 degrees above the horizon. i thought to myself,"what is that?" as i continued to observe the object i did not think it was a ufo, i simply tried to figure out what it was and i could not fit it into any familiar category that i knew of. i thought perhaps it is a bird, but as i kept looking i could not detect any head or wings or feet or tail. it appeared as a distinct sherical object moving at a steady pace, not fast. the side of the object that was towards the sun was very shiny like polished metal. the side away from the sun looked dull greyish. at this point i could not tell how far away it was or how high. then i saw a large bird in the sky that appeared to be a hawk or a buzzard, or some other large bird. this bird then began flying towards the object as if to check it out. when the bird appeared to be about two feet or so away from the object, the bird abruptly turned away at about a ninty degree angle and flew away and did not return. this gave me an idea of the size of the object, and about how far away it was, by comparing the wingspan of the bird. the object appeared to be very near, and perhaps 200 feet in the air(this is merely a guess) it is hard to estimate the height. even at this stage, i did not think i was seeing a ufo, i was just trying to figure out what it was. i've seen balloons in the sky, and this did not look like that. balloons usually seem to rise, this object moved laterally. also, it was very shiny. i had to go ahead and make my left turn, so i lost sight of it as i turned north. it was at this point that it hit me how odd this was, i had never seen anything even close to this. at he next block i turned around to go back and see if was still visible. this took probably little over a minute. but when i got back there was nothing to see. i then remembered video i had seen on tv of sightings in mexico i think of shiny spherical objects, and what i saw was identical to those videos. later in the day when i thought about it, i felt that it was strange that i did not get excited or afraid when i was seeing this. it was like i had suspended judgement and was merely an observer. as i left the scene of the sighting, i went about my business running some errands and then went to work. i didnt even think about it for a while, until i was at work and i told some people about it. they were all skeptical. i cannot say what it was i saw, but it was so distinct of an object, not fuzzy, or in the sun, or obscurred in any way. it was as plain as day.
content.summary: Spherical shape about two or three feet diameter moving slowly from north to south

content.altitude: Landed, Treetop, Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover), Unknown
content.detailedDescription:
I was with my boyfriend, ray, and our friends, shawn and debbie. we were camping for the weekend at applegate lake in southern oregon, near the small town of applegate. i can't remember exactly what month it was. i do know that it was sometime in the summer because we were camping at hart-tish campground and it is only open during the summer months. it was a fairly warm, saturday evening. it was a beautiful night, the water on the lake was so calm, and the stars were abundant.
 sometime just prior to midnight, shawn and debbie were fishing off the shore of the lake. ray and i joined them about 30 minutes later. as soon as we reached them, they excitedly told us that about 15 minutes before that, they both witnessed what they described as the most spectacular meteor/falling star/fireball shoot down from the sky. they both stated that they had never seen anything like it before and they wanted to know if we had seen it. we told them that we did not and debbie went on to describe it as something that looked like it was exploding as it fell from the sky. she said it was huge and that it seemed like it landed across the lake in the mountains. they were very dramatic about the way that they described it to us and very excited about what they had witnessed. 
being that i am a stargazer and it was such a gorgeous night, i asked ray if we could float around the lake in our tahiti. i had never been on the water at night, so we all decided to float around the lake. by the time we all got situated, the water had lots of ripples but there was no wind. the air was very still and calm. we did notice however that the sky was lighting up all along the direction of the opposite side of the lake from us. we thought that there must have been some lightning going on in the far distance, although, it was beautiful and clear where we were. shawn and debbie took off before us in their rowboat and headed to the left.  as we started to paddle off, we were having trouble getting anywhere.  our tahiti kept spinning in cirles.  we thought that maybe we needed to switch places so we did but that didn't help. it seemed as if we could only stay near the edge of the lake.  the more we would get near the middle of the lake, the more we would spin and get nowhere. it just seemed like we couldn't get anywhere no matter how hard ray tried to paddle. by this time, we could no longer see shawn and debbie. it was too dark. we decided to stay to the right since we were having trouble. as we took off, i noticed what looked like maybe a tanker truck/fire truck of some sort, driving down the road across the lake from us. it turned onto a dirt road, headed up the mountain. we couldn't see it anymore but it was headed in the direction that debbie had earlier described as the area that the fireball seemed to have fallen.
from our viewpoint, there was no one else on the lake other than shawn and debbie. although at this point, we still could not see them. the direction that i was facing was the direction that shawn and debbie had gone. i was in a reclining position, looking up at the constellation pleiades [which is my favorite of all constellations]. suddenly, at the top of the mountain, some bright lights came on. they were so bright that i thought it was possibly the truck that i had seen disappear up the dirt road. i thought that maybe they had reached the top and that they were facing the lake and turned on their bright halogen lights.  it was very eerie. it frightened me because i figured whoever was in that vehicle was looking right down on us in the lake and that they could probably see us very well.  ray had a cigarette lit and i even made him put it out, hoping that it would be harder for them to see us. we just looked like an easy target for anyone who might be target shooting! ray turned the tahiti around so i wasn't facing the light and told me to relax.  i kept turning around and looking because they were not turning off their lights. then, i noticed that the lights were getting higher in the trees, which didn't make sense.  i then became very startled when i realized the lights were actually now at the treetops. i said "oh my god ray...Look!!! it's rising!!! we watched it get higher and higher, above the trees!! as it got higher, we could see that it was much bigger and brighter. we were both freaked out and started heading back to shore. i then spotted shawn and debbie's flashlight waving and although we couldn't make out their boat yet, we started screaming for them and they were screaming for us.  as we got closer to them, we could hear them screaming, "do you see it???!!!?...Do you see it????"  it was so huge and soooo bright and just ever so slowly rose in the sky. as it rose, it was going away from us. we all sat in our boats and watched it slowly rise for about 2 hours. as we compared events, the told us that they too could not get far from shore because their boat would spin. debbie said that shawn picked up his flashlight and started waving it when the light was at the treetops. she got scared and made him put it out. she didn't want to draw attention to them. she thought it was a ufo at that point, and she believes that whatever it was that she saw earlier in the sky, had something to do with this object that we were now witnessing.  after it was quite high in the sky, all the ripples in the lake suddenly subsided and we had no problem paddling our boats. we were thoroughly exhausted by this time and getting quite cold so we decided to go back to camp.  shawn and i took up the first load from our boats.  when we came back, debbie and ray had noticed that they could see what looked like thousands of fish across the lake from us, all along the shoreline...The same side as the earlier flashes which we thought was lightning, the same side that the object seemed to fall from the sky, the same side that the light appeared on the mountain.  co-incidence??? i doubt it. phenomenon?...We perceived it as some magnetic occurrence in the water due to whatever it was that rose off of that mountain. i couldn't let it go. everyone else finally fell asleep, but i sat on the ground watching this light move further and further away.  finally, around 7:00 in the morning, i couldn't watch any longer. the object now appeared to be the brightness of a distant star. the sun was out and all the stars in the sky were gone...Except for what was left of this object that rose in the sky before my eyes, several hours earlier.  i tried to draw the shape of this incredibly bright object. i'm not sure how to explain it. it was a shaped most like an oval but it kind of had an indentation on top of it. it's hard to describe the shape of a huge, bright, moving, light.
a few years after our sighting, my son was watching a program on t.V. about ufo sightings. he yelled for me to come listen because a couple of men were telling their story and it was very much like ours. same scenario...On a lake, at night, even waved their flashlights towards it. but they said their light came towards them and now some 10 -20 years later, they are having dreams of abduction! 
about 2 years ago, i received a phone call from a friend of mine whom i had told my experience to.  she said that she was listening to one of the radio stations in our area. the subject was talking about ufo's and someone called in saying that they had experienced a ufo sighting at applegate lake. according to my friend, the caller had been camping in the area around the same time that we were. 
i know that what we witnessed was paranormal. i am so thankful that our friends were there to collaborate our experience with this unusual event!
content.summary: On a lake, middle of night, 4 of us witness object rising off of mountain in front of us, magnetic currents in water, unusual behavior of fish

content.detailedDescription:
From back of original print- view looking back toward cairns from normandy island. we spent the day on a trip to the great barrier reef, had lunch on an island as part of a sight seeing trip. this was just a random picture i took to show these islands. i was using an advantix camera (aps cartridge) and the original print (4 x 12 inches) cropped the top and bottom of the image. therefore the objects were not seen. recently i took the cartridge to costco to have the images (40 images) placed on an archive quality disk. this is when i discovered the objects in the picture. one in the upper left side of the picture and a faint one mid picture just where the water turns to dark blue. 
we were in cairns march 17-20 so i am guessing the picture was taken the 18th or 19th. i can't say for sure what time exactly the picture was taken as it was a run of the mill picture until just a few days ago. i know that there had previously been a lot of rain and flooding and the boat had to take a slightly different route than normal to get us to the island. further description on the back of the picture was that the 2 center islands are one joined together by a narrow strip of land with the passageway between the far right island and the left island. 
that is about as much as i can remember.
content.summary: Unseen when photographed, unseen on original print (cropped out)

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving with my friend dylan back to his dad's apartment, and we were catching up and just talking when we stopped at a red light around 7th street and greenway parkway when we both at the sametime saw this light in the sky to the right of us. we were both so awed, at first i thouhgt it might have been a flare but flares dont go that high and fall straight down this didnt. it was a flourescent green light that was almost a sphere but because of all the light and its brief fall iam not sure its exact shape. but it straightened out and then begin to fall again, and we never saw it land or crash or anything and we drove around a little bit to see if we could spot anything else but we never did so we went back home. 
(when i saw the object i felt amazement and wonder.)
content.summary: Something caught my eye over to the right and it was flourescent green falling and it looked like it was falling but then straightened out and started to go down and just dissapered like it should have landed or crashed but it never did.

content.detailedDescription:
At approximately 4:55 pm on 2/7/07, i was travelling eastbound on i-88, near naperville road. in front of me i saw a brown, rectangular object crossing the sky at approximately a 50 degree angle. i would have estimated its distance as a couple miles away. it was moving in a north to south direction. 

 my initial thought was that it was one of those banners that is dragged behind an airplane as an advertisement, but i could not see an airplane ahead of it. i don't think i was the only one who saw it, because another driver actually stopped his car and was following the object as it continued to move south. 

 as i continued east, the object continued west, and i bot a back view of it, and it seemed triangluar in its back, kind of like a giant wedge. the skin seemed to flutter like cloth. 

 i am reasonably sure that this probably has a sensible explanation for it.
content.summary: Unkown object over chicago area

content.detailedDescription:
On march 17th 2002, while on a church crossing for work (i'm a police officer) i saw a ufo over my patrol vehicle.  at first i thought it was a helicopter since it remained stationary in the sky.
i activated my patrol car video camera and taped the object, moving my patrol vehicle several times to keep it in the view finder (128x magnification).
it appeared to be diamond shaped.  the object then started to float away, but did not bob or spin as if it were a baloon. that's really what made me think it was 'odd' and the reason i taped it.
i don't know where else to report/submit this.
i have seen several shows, including the one with actor dan ackaroid and saw the same object that i have on tape/cd on his film.
i can be contacted at my above e-mail address.
steve
content.summary: Caught on film

content.detailedDescription:
My wife and i live in council bluffs, iowa. a bluff is like a little mountain/large hill, and we live on the top of one. we have an excellant view of the city of omaha, ne, which is just across the missouri river.
saturday january 6, 2007 was the first sighting, these sightings have continued for over a month. their routine changes every week. sometimes there are two, most of the time, it is just one. they are not nor have they ever tried to hide themselves. this is a pretty long story, but several weeks ago i e-mailed the mufon nebraska head, john c. kasher, and he never got back to me. i was inquiring why the web site was not discussing/publishing this phenomenom. i told him that i have film footage of it. in fact, i have over 6 hours of it. i would really like to have someone trustworthy analyze this footage. i can fill in all the details for you later, if you like, but the film speaks for itself. it is pretty convincing and unfortunately, the real convincing occurances, we never got on film. there have to have been scores of people in omaha who witnessed are witnessing this thing(s). my step daughter lives in omaha and she has seen it several times. please advise.

                        thanking you in advance,
                          
                         joe m. fahey
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Sightings have occured beginning at dusk january 6, 2007 to present. please see below.

content.detailedDescription: Me, my brother and sister-in law were enjoying the clear night sky around a bon-fire at our hunting schack in central minnesota, when we noticed a brighter star-like object very fast light moving across the sky from the west. when we noticed it, we knew it could not be an aircraft, as the speed it moved across the sky was just plain way too fast!!  we weren't sure, and looked in the sky for another aircraft as a reference speed and found one.  when we looked back, we noticed it had started to go from left to right in an upwards direction.  it continued it's course eastward, then suddenly went upwards moving slightly towards the east much much faster than it moved across the sky, in a matter of seconds it was out of our eyesight. at that point, we realized it could not have been an aircraft, nor a satellite!   my brother saw it again the next night, travel the same sort of path, at appoximately the same time.  but we have never seen it again.  we tried to rule out the possiblity of it being a non earth-like flying phenonmenon, but due to it's speed it moved across the sky and the fast back and forth manuevers it made, it was just not at all possible to determine it was of this earth.  we realized there was no other alternative explaination. we still look for it whenever we are there.
content.summary: It flew almost all the way  across the clear night horizon far too fast to be an aircraft or a satelitte, zig-zagged, then darted upwards out of sight.

content.detailedDescription: After 20 some odd years of looking up, i have finally seen a ufo!  last night at around midnight i was watching tv when i happened to glance out the window and there was a bright orange oval shaped thing in the sky behind the trees, and it was traveling in the direction of my house.  it could not have been a meteor, it was too bright and too slow. and it seemed to travel up, not down.  i got too scared to walk outside and see where it was going.
content.summary: Bright orange lit up the sky

content.detailedDescription: On february 6, 2007 my brother, mother and i were all coming back from dinner, when all of the sudden we saw these lights in the sky. my mom quickly pulled over and we rushed out of the car. when we looked up, about 15 miles ahead of us and approximately 5,000 feet up, we saw a swarm of lights in a sphere shape, moving in unison together. the lights were perfectly aligned. there were thousands of lights. they were colors of blue, green and red. the object was huge! an airplane had flown next to it, and was about 1/50 the size of it. this object made no noise, and was moving slowly northwest. when the object flew through the moon's light, there was no direct "outline" or "metal body" to the object. it was completely see through filled with lights. we watched for about ten minutes, until it floated northwest. i didn't know what it was when i first noticed it because of it's massive size. but once we stopped and looked at it for a while, i knew this was something out of the ordinary. i was able to take pictures of the object from my phone, but it just looks like a light in the sky. the object slowly faded away once it went further out towards the city. that was my experience with an unidentified flying object!
content.summary: A large, sphere like object with thousands of lights surrounding it and within it.

content.detailedDescription:
I just want to send this image in and see what you think it could be, i have the original i can send through a private email, as i would feel better about sending it that way.
i work in forensics in law enforcement and wish my name not to be mentioned right now until i find out what this is.
i left the meta data attatched to the image so you can see the setting in which it was taken, the camera used was a fuji s2 pro and the original image size is 4256x2848.
the image was an accident, i was trying to photograph lighting and this is what i got, i never saw the object until i looked at the images later on my pc.
sorry about the copy transparent on the image, i just did not want anyone to try and enhance or alter the image and make it something it is not.
the original has not been touched and is just as it was when it was taken, i can send the original and please feel free to have it verified that it has not been altered in any way.
just wanted to get your expert opinion on what this might be and if you may have observed anything like this before as most of the images i have seen are always grainy or very blurred and leave to much to the imagination.
dave
content.summary: Taken while trying to capture lighting pics

content.detailedDescription:
I was outside admiring the beauty of the cloud clusters after the rain.  i was on the side of my house facing north, it was about 2:16pm. i grabbed my camera and started to take pictures.  upon taking the first photo, i reviewed it, and noticed something in the clouds.   i began taking more photos, and noticed objects in those as well.  initially while i was taking the photos, there were no objects in the clouds.

======================================================================
please do not post this:

i have noticed this type of experience on several occasions, could it be that these objects can only be detected by infared technology, something the camera can pick up after the fact, or are these objects moving so fast we cannot see them with our naked eye.

pic 1 - jan24_01_2007  (one object seen in the top left)
pic 2 - jan24_02_2007  (three objects - shaped like a triangle)
pic 3 - jan24_03_2007  (one object seen in the top left)                     

if you wish to contact me please call my cellular phone.  i do not wish to be interviewed by an investigator at this time. thank you,
content.summary: Objects seen in photo

content.detailedDescription:
Santa clara, ca. - my girlfriend and i were walking from a restaurant into a theater through the parking lot, i stopped to light a cigarette and looked west and saw the most massive greenish light glaring down from the sky, just like a spotlight in fog, however, it was a crystal clear night, so this was not a normal halogen or led type light. it started from a small point and expanded as it went down, i'm surprised everybody in california couldnt see this.  from the point it was coming from, there was another white light beaming up slightly tilted in about the 1 o'clock position, we both stood there just watching this for minutes in complete amazement, i'd never seen anything like it before or since. from the size, it looked to possibly be out maybe a hundred miles (well over the pacific ocean), so the widest point in the cone shaped light i could see had to be at least a couple miles wide.

the following day in the news they said it was a test missile launched from and island in the pacific, which had gone wrong (not sure of the exact details).  however, if this was a missile gone "wrong" why would a missile have such sophisticated lighting, and almost intentionally be beaming down with purpose for at least five minutes?

i still wonder to this day, the news said it could be seen from as far as southern california, so this light was massive!

if anybody else saw this event please e-mail me at "robogden2002@yahoo.Com" and lemme know your story and theories, because i truly believe this to be a u.F.O. sighting.
content.summary: Massive green spotlight over california (sf bay area)

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting on the deck of the house, talking on the phone. in the distance i saw one red round light in the sky. then another light came on as the 1st red light turned off. this happened until there was approx 5-6 lights in a row lit up and then off, then it would go back to the 1st light, light up, then off, then on to the next light beside. (i knew this was an ufo, ive seen them before back in nv). this lasted about 2-3 minutes, and the lights just stopped. after the event and in less then 90 seconds aiforce jets flew over and around the area where i saw the ufo. my feelings were very intense that i just saw a ufo. this siting was much clearer then the one i saw in nv.
content.summary: 5+ bright lights hover, lights on and off. southern oregon
